name: lib/App.js
App
description: SuperRouter app object. Builds a middleware stack.

name: use
description:
Adds a middleware route. When a request is processed, middleware functions are executed with
the request and response in the order they were registered. Middleware can optionally specify path
and method filters. If not supplied, the middleware will be executed against all requests. If just
a function is provided, it is used as the middleware handler.

If a middleware returns a promise, the app will wait for that promise to resolve or reject before
moving to the next middleware in the stack.

If a handler throws an error or rejects its promise, further middleware will be skipped, and the
chain will move to the error stack.

params.name: route
params.description:
The middleware route. If a function is provided, it will be
 used as the handler. If a plain object is provided, it will be run through the Route constructor.

name: useError
description:
Adds an error-handling middleware route. These routes are processed in order, and will only be
invoked if the previous middleware has thrown or rejected with an error. They are invoked with
the request, response, and previous error. If just a function is provided, it is used as the
middleware handler.

If the middleware returns a promise, the app will wait for that promise to resolve or reject before
moving to the next middleware in the stack.

params.name: route
params.description:
The middleware route. If a function is provided, it will be
 used as the handler. If a plain object is provided, it will be run through the Route constructor.

name: processRequest
description:
Process a request through the middleware stack. Evaluates the request against each middleware and error
middleware as appropriate. Resolves to a Response object. If the promise chain ends in a rejection,
will reject with the last error thrown.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise<Response>} - A promise for a valid response object.

return.description: A promise for a valid response object.

name: lib/METHODS.js
lib/Node.js
Node
description:
Router Node.
Represents a unique path on the router. Each node may contain one route per method, and any number of child nodes.
Nodes build a linked tree structure, representing each unique route on the router. It is used to serve OPTIONS
requests.

name: constructor
description:
Node constructor.

Creating a node automatically registers the OPTIONS request on this path.

params.name: options.path
params.description: The path pattern the node represents

name: path
description: Gets the path pattern that the node represents.

name: _parsePath
description:
Parses the given path string against this node's path pattern. If the input path is a match, returns
an object whose key value pairs are the matched route params and their values. If the path is not a match,
returns false.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean|Object} - False if the path is not a match, an object if it is.

return.description: False if the path is not a match, an object if it is.

name: addRoute
description:
Adds a route to the node. Will throw an error if the route does not match the path of the node, if there is
already a route registered on the given method, or if the route method is ALL (routes on a node must be
deterministic).

params.name: route
params.description: The route to add to the node.

name: addChild
description: Adds a child node to this node.

params.name: node
params.description: The node to add as a child.

name: getChildren
description: Returns the node's children as an array.

name: getRoutes
description: Returns the node's routes as an array.

unknown.tagValue: {Array<Route>} - The routes associated with this node.

return.description: The routes associated with this node.

name: isParent
description: Indicates if this node is a parent to a route by comparing their paths.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - If this node is a parent to the input route.

return.description: If this node is a parent to the input route.

name: isSame
description: Indicates if this node represents the same path as a route.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - If this node is the same path as the input route.

return.description: If this node is the same path as the input route.

name: canInsert
description: Indicates if the node can insert a route. Returns true if the node is the same or a parent to the route.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - If the route can be inserted on this node.

return.description: If the route can be inserted on this node.

name: insert
description:
Recursively inserts a route into the node.
If the node is not the same or a parent to the route, has no effect.
If the route is on the same path as the node, adds the route to this node.
If the route can be inserted on a child node, recurses down to the child node.
Otherwise, adds a new child node to this node, then adds the route to the child node.

name: find
description:
Recursively finds a route that matches the specified request. Returns a matching route or null if not match
can be found.

params.name: request
params.description: The request to find a matching route against

name: toObject
description: Returns a pojo representation of the node.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - Plain object representation of the node.

return.description: Plain object representation of the node.

name: lib/Request.js
Request
description: SuperRouter Request object.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new request object.

name: originalPath
description:
Returns the original path of the request. The original path is the path that the request
was initialized with, and cannot be changed, even if the path is later updated.

name: path
description: Returns the request path

name: path
description: Sets the request path.

name: method
description: Returns the request method. Request method will be lower-cased.

name: method
description: Sets the request method. Input is case-insensitive.

name: headers
description: Returns the request headers as a plain object. Keys and values are lower-cased.

name: getHeader
description: Returns the value of a request header. Input is case-insensitive.

name: body
description: Returns the underlying request body stream.

name: body
description: Sets the request body value.

name: lib/Response.js
Response
description: SuperRouter Response object.

name: statusCode
description: Gets the status code of the response.

name: statusCode
description: Sets the status code of the response.

name: headers
description:
Gets the headers of the response as a plain object. Response header key / value pairs are all
lower-cased.

name: getHeader
description:
Gets the value of a response header. Keys are case-insensitive. Returns undefined if the header
is not set.

name: setHeader
description: Sets the value of a response header. Keys and values are case-insensitive.

name: clearHeader
description: Clears the value of a response header.

name: body
description: Returns the underlying response body stream.

name: getBody
description:
Returns the response body according to how it was most recently set. If the body is being
used as a stream, will return the body stream. If the body is being written with values, will
return the last assigned value.

name: setBody
description:
Sets the value of the response body. If the value is a readable stream, it will be piped into
the underlying response body stream. If the value is plain type, it will be written to the
underlying body stream.

name: lib/Route.js
Route
description:
Route class.
A route is defined as a path pattern, method, and handler. Testing requests against routes and executing matching
handlers is the core of request processing.

name: constructor
description: Instantiates a new Route.

params.name: options.handler
params.description: The handler function to be executed if the route is matched.

params.name: path
params.description:
The path pattern that the route should be executed against. If not provided,
 matches all paths.

params.name: method
params.description:
The method that the route should be executed against. If not provided, mathes
 all methods.

name: path
description: Returns the route path.

name: method
description: Returns the route method.

name: handler
description: Returns the route handler.

name: _isMethodMatch
description: Tests if the given method matches this route

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - If the method matches this route

return.description: If the method matches this route

name: _parsePath
description:
Parses the given path string against this route's path pattern. If the input path is a match, returns
an object whose key value pairs are the matched route params and their values. If the path is not a match,
returns false.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean|Object} - False if the path is not a match, an object if it is.

return.description: False if the path is not a match, an object if it is.

name: isMatch
description: Tests whether a given request object is a match against this route, satisfying the path & method requirements.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} - Whether the request matches this route.

return.description: Whether the request matches this route.

name: execute
description:
Executes this route against a provided request / response. Returns a promise that will resolve or reject when
execution is complete.
 - If the request is not a match, returns an empty promise.
 - If the request is a match, returns a promise for the return value of the route handler

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - A promise that will complete when execution is complete.

params.name: options.request
params.description: The request the route will be tested & executed against

params.name: options.response
params.description: The response the route handler will be invoked with

return.description: A promise that will complete when execution is complete.

name: lib/RouteTree.js
lib/Router.js
Router
description: SuperRouter Router object

name: addRoute
description:
Adds a route to the router. Routes must be unique and deterministic (no splats or optionals). Routes can
be annotated with additional information, will be available on the Request after matching.

Any route parameters defined in the path will be available on the request.routeParams object when the
handler is executed.

If the route handler returns a promise, the app will wait for that promise to resolve or reject before
moving to the next middleware in the stack.

params.name: route
params.description:
The route definition. If a plain object is provided, will be run through the
  Route constructor.

name: match
description:
Middleware to be consumed by a SuperRouter App instance. Causes a request to be matched against
the router. The matched route will be assigned to `request.matchedRoute`. In the case of no match,
the middleware does not throw an error; the matchedRoute key will simply be undefined.

params.name: options
params.description: The request & response used by app middleware.

name: execute
description:
Middleware to be consumed by a SuperRouter App instance. Causes the handler of a matched route to
be executed. If `request.matchedRoute` is not defined, the middleware does nothing.

params.name: options
params.description: The request & response used by app middleware.

name: lib/index.js
lib/middleware/ContentNegotiation.js
lib/utils.js
utils
description: Utility class

name: comparePaths
description:
Compares two path pattern strings, as used in routing. Returns 0 if they are the same (they would match
the same request path). Returns 1 if the first path is a parent to the second path. Returns -1 if the
second path is a parent, sibling, or cousin.

name: normalizePath
description:
Normalizes path strings for routing and requests.
 - Strips trailing slashes
 - Lowercases path parts other than route params

name: normalizeMethod
description: Normalizes a method string to lower case

name: isValidMethod
description: Tests if a method string is valid.
